lead_paragraph: WHITNEY--Wheelock, died May 20, 2016, at his home in Independence, MN. He was 89. A man of broad and deep interests, Wheelock lived an extraordinarily full life. An adoring husband, ever-supportive father, loving grandfather and faithful friend, he left an indelible mark on countless lives through his activities as civic leader, educator, businessman, politician and sportsman. He is survived by his wife Kathleen Blatz; children Wheelock III (Sandro Cagnin), Pennell (Edward Cremo), Joseph (Desiree), Ben (Mary); three stepsons, eleven grandchildren, two stepgrandsons and three great- granddaughters; and by his sister Sally Pillsbury. He was preceded in death by wife Irene Hixon Whitney and brother J. Kimball Whitney. 1/3
